## Problem

## Steps to reproduce

`nvim --clean --cmd 'set rtp^=.' sort-diags.lua +11`
```lua
vim.diagnostic.config({ severity_sort = true, virtual_lines = { current_line = true } })

local ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('test_stable_diag')
local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()

-- local m = vim.v.maxcol
local m = 100
local l = 10
local diagnostics = {
  { end_col = m, lnum = l, message = 'a', severity = 2 },
  { end_col = m, lnum = l, message = 'b', severity = 2 },
  { end_col = m, lnum = l, message = 'c', severity = 2 },
  { end_col = m, lnum = 20, message = 'd', severity = 2 },
  { end_col = m, lnum = 20, message = 'e', severity = 2 },
  { end_col = m, lnum = 20, message = 'f', severity = 2 },
}

vim.diagnostic.set(ns, bufnr, diagnostics, {})
vim.diagnostic.show(ns, bufnr)

local shown = vim.diagnostic.get(bufnr)
print('Order of diagnostics')
for i, d in ipairs(shown) do
  print(i, d.message)
end
```
The virtual lines (top to down): `b c a`.

The reason seems lua sort is non-stable, so when severity is equal then the order is random.

Related: https://github.com/rachartier/tiny-inline-diagnostic.nvim/pull/164
